task.title: Inviting meeting participants by phone
task.shortdesc: When the dial-out option is enabled, moderators can invite users to join a meeting by phone.

taskbody.prereq: Your environment must allow dialing out and you must be a meeting moderator. The server administrator sets the dial-out option. For more information, see Enabling Meeting Dial-out.
taskbody.context: During a meeting, moderators can add a participant to the meeting by calling their phone. By answering the phone, the call recipient joins the meeting in audio mode only. The avatar for the person contains their phone number. To dial out, you must know the full phone number, including the country code.

step.cmd: Tap the participant icon () to open the list of meeting participants.
At the bottom of the participant list, click Invite by phone.
In the dialogue box, type the phone number and click the plus sign. You can add multiple phone numbers.
step.info: Ensure that the country code precedes all numbers. For example, US numbers start with the country code 1.

step.cmd: When you finish entering phone numbers, tap Invite.
step.info: Invitees join the meeting when they answer the call.
